duties_responsibilities.duty: Read, review, and redline contracts, as well as negotiate contract terms.
Identify, lead, and execute spend category and supply strategies.
Work with key business partners to prioritize sourcing initiatives and/or contract negotiations.
Manage Requests for Information (RFI) and Proposal (RFP) from suppliers, competitive bidding events, supplier proposal reviews, and negotiations with suppliers.
Collaborate with corporate legal services to identify supplier negotiation strategies and review and execute contracts.
Periodically review and analyze supply chain to ensure supplier base is consistent with corporate responsibility goals.
Evaluate the utilization of the products used post implementation.
Implement process improvements, increase operational efficiencies, ensure data accuracy, compliance, and positive customer experience.
Evaluate spending and vendors to identify and execute strategic sourcing initiatives, contract negotiations, and additional sourcing and category management activities.
Manage stakeholder engagement throughout the initiative, delegation of activities and tasks to drive process to completion.
Provide periodic updates, report on progress and expected results to business area leadership.
Analyze and continuously monitor market and industry data to ensure programs remain competitive.
Leverage process teams, applications, and tools to identify the best approach for handling operational transactions and drive efficiency.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in business, finance, supply chain, economics, or contract law.
Certified Professional in Supply Management (C.P.S.M. or CMRP) preferred.
